page.title: 13Shalford Telephone Exchange
page.content: Although not at{Shalford Green, the exchange is so named to avoid confusion with{Shelford.}It opened in 1976 and is fully automatic.{David {Rose,}a{British Telecom}Technical Officer makes a weekly check here and at other exchanges. It serves over 1,300 people in{Shalford, Blackmore {End, Beazley End, Jaspers Green, {Wethersfield}and some of{Panfield.} The Exchange is fully electronic and there are very few moving parts so there is little noise. Cables carry 1400-1500 wires each. Dry compressed air is fed into the cables to keep water out. In the event of a power cut, emergency lighting and a diesel fuelled generator switch on to supply the tungsten batteries. An alarm system is connected to{Bishops {Stortford.
